00031 #include <iostream>
00032 #include <string>
00033 #include <boost/scoped_ptr.hpp>
00034 #include <boost/shared_ptr.hpp>
00035 #include "Arguments.hpp"
00036 #include "Settings.hpp"
00037 #include "Builder.hpp"
00038 #include "FileRecorder.hpp"
00039 #include "NTee.hpp"
00040 
00041 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00042 {
00045    std::string USAGE("Usage: ntee [-h|--help] [-o <path>] [--sock <tcp|udp>] [-p <N>]\n"
00046                      "             -L <host> <port> -R <cmd> [@NTEEPORT] [args...]\n");
00047    std::string HELP( "Purpose: NTEE is a program which sits between two other programs communicating\n"
00048                      "         through sockets.  As traffic comes between programs L and R, ntee\n"
00049                      "         records the timing and data being sent for further analysis or play-\n"
00050                      "         back.  The options in the command line usage reflect that there are\n"
00051                      "         two programs, a left side process 'L', and right side process 'R'\n"
00052                      "         with ntee sitting in the middle.\n"
00053                      "\n"
00054                      "   +---+                           +------+                         +---+\n"
00055                      "   | L |---listen---><---connect---| ntee |----fork/exec----------->| R |\n"
00056                      "   |___|                           |______|---listen--><--connect---|___|\n"
00057                      "\n"
00058                      "Flags:\n"
00059                      "  -o <path>         Path to where the output should be written.\n" 
00060                      "                    Defaults to ./ntee_output\n"
00061                      "  --sock <tcp|udp>  Defines the socket type which the L and R side processes\n"
00062                      "                    are using.  Defaults to tcp.\n"
00063                      "  -p <int>          Forces the port number upon which ntee will serve to the\n"
00064                      "                    R side process.  This is here in case the R program has\n"
00065                      "                    its connection hardcoded to use a certain port.\n"
00066                      "  -L <ip> <int>     The ip address and port number of the L side process.\n"
00067                      "                    ntee will connect to this process after the R side program\n"
00068                      "                    has been started and decides to connect with ntees service\n"
00069                      "                    port.\n"
00070                      "  -R <cmd> [args]   The user specifies the R side process by giving its\n"
00071                      "                    command line argument, the special argument @NTEEPORT can\n"
00072                      "                    be inserted anywhere in the args where the port number\n"
00073                      "                    that the process would connect would ordinarily be specified\n"
00074                      "                    with.  Ntee will also define the $NTEEPORT environment var\n"
00075                      "                    to the value which is being used for the ntee service port.\n"
00076                      "                    NOTE: Because the argument parsing fills the array holding\n"
00077                      "                          the command specified with any and all remaining args,\n"
00078                      "                          the -R specification MUST BE THE LAST thing on the\n"
00079                      "                          command line!  Other options the follow -R will be\n"
00080                      "                          used in the starting of the R side client and not as\n"
00081                      "                          settings for ntee.\n"
00082                      "\n"
00083                      "Notes:\n"
00084                      "  - Both the -L and -R arguments must be specified for ntee to start properly.\n"
00085                      "  - The -R option must be the final option passed to ntee!\n"
00086                      "\n"
00087                );  /* end of HELP */
00088                    
00089    //** Collect the arguments
00090    using namespace ntee;
00091    Arguments args(USAGE, HELP);
00092    Settings s = args.parse( argc, argv );
00093    
00094    //** Based on the settings, build the right NTee type and add the FileRecorder
00095    boost::scoped_ptr<NTee> pNT( Builder::build( s ) );
00096    pNT->addRecorder( boost::shared_ptr<Recorder>(new FileRecorder(s) ));
00097    return pNT->start();
00098 }
